comments:
I observed this problem with RSE 1.0RC2

I don't know if this problem affects different Platform/OS, so I picked "All".
Feel free to change that if necessary.

I opened a connection to a remote system (Windows dstore)
I tried a paste operation in the remote scratchpad.

Dave - this appears to be similar to another one you fixed earlier, perhaps it's an easy fix?

Lothar - we will need to know what you tried to paste, and on which platform. Can you please add this information? Please always pick the Platform that you observed the problem on. Use "All" only if you reproduced the issue on at least 2 platforms.

Created an attachment (id=52519)
eclipse log file

My first test was on Linux 32bit. I did a new test with Linux 64bit and I get an error here, too

I had a text in the clipboard (from Linux, not from Eclipse copy operation)

-----------Enter bugs above this line-----------
RSE 1.0 Testing round 2/3
installation : eclipse-platform-3.2 (3.2.0.v20060603)
               actually this is a eclipse project export of our product based on Eclipse 3.2 that contains RSE
RSE install  : SDK download RSE 1.0RC2
java.runtime : java version "1.5.0_06"
               Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_06-b05)
               Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 1.5.0_06-b05, mixed mode)
os.name:     : Linux janus 2.6.15-27-amd64-generic #1 SMP PREEMPT Sat Sep 16 01:50:50 UTC 2006 x86_64 GNU/Linux
------------------------------------------------
systemtype   : Unix-ssh
targetos     : Kubuntu Linux Dapper (6.06)
targetuname  : Linux janus 2.6.15-27-amd64-generic #1 SMP PREEMPT Sat Sep 16 01:50:50 UTC 2006 x86_64 GNU/Linux
------------------------------------------------
systemtype   : Windows dstore
targetos     : Microsoft Windows XP [Version 5.1.2600]
targetvm     : java version "1.5.0_06"
               Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_06-b05)
               Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_06-b05, mixed mode, sharing)
------------------------------------------------

Originally, non-RSE objects were not intended for this view, but I can see how
Strings and other adaptable resources would be of use there along side RSE
things.  I have a fix for this however there are a couple limitations.  The
context menu actions for the non-RSE resources will be limited.
